rules: Rule1: Either using a hammer requires wearing safety goggles or using a saw requires wearing safety goggles.
Rule2: Whenever the chef is cooking with the oven, the chef is baking with the oven.
Rule3: The chef is cooking with the oven or the assistant is cooking with the oven.
Rule4: Under the condition that the assistant is cooking with the oven, the power outlet is located in the kitchen.
Rule5: Provided that the chef is baking with the oven, the power outlet is located in the kitchen.
Rule6: If the chef is preparing the ingredients, then the chef is measuring on the countertop.

Rule7: In the case that the chef is using the recipe book, then: if the negation of the implication that using a hammer requires wearing safety goggles implies safety goggles are being worn leads to requiring an extension cord for the power drill, then the chef is preparing the ingredients.
Rule8: Either the chef is using the recipe book or the assistant is using the recipe book.

Rule9: When the assistant is using the recipe book, then: provided that the negation of the implication that using a hammer requires wearing safety goggles implies safety goggles are being worn results in requiring an extension cord for the power drill, the chef is preparing the ingredients.
Rule10: Under the condition that using a saw requires wearing safety goggles, then safety goggles are being worn.
Rule11: Provided that the power outlet is located in the kitchen, then if using a circular saw requires an extension cord, using a power drill requires an extension cord.
Rule12: The blender is connected to the power outlet or the microwave is connected to the power outlet.
Rule13: If the microwave is connected to the power outlet, then the power outlet is located in the kitchen.
Rule14: The flour is stored in the pantry, or if the toaster is plugged into the power outlet, then if the blender is connected to the power outlet, the power outlet is located in the kitchen.
Rule15: Under the condition that it is not the case that using a hammer requires wearing safety goggles implies safety goggles are being worn, then using a circular saw requires an extension cord.

Rule16: Provided that it is not the case that using a hammer requires wearing safety goggles implies safety goggles are being worn, then it is not the case that using a power drill requires an extension cord.

Rule17: If it is not the case that the wine rack is mounted on the wall or the dishwasher is installed in the cabinets or if the refrigerator is placed on the floor then the power outlet is located in the kitchen, then the kitchen island is positioned in the center.

Rule18: Whenever it is not the case that the wine rack is mounted on the wall or the dishwasher is installed in the cabinets or if the refrigerator is placed on the floor then the power outlet is located in the kitchen, then it is not the case that the kitchen island is positioned in the center.

Rule19: Under the condition that it is not the case that the negation of the implication that using a hammer requires wearing safety goggles implies safety goggles are being worn leads to requiring an extension cord for the power drill, then it is not the case that the chef is measuring on the countertop.
facts: Fact1: The refrigerator is placed on the floor.
Fact2: The toaster is plugged into the power outlet.
Fact3: It is not the case that the dishwasher is installed in the cabinets.
Fact4: It is not the case that the wine rack is mounted on the wall.
Fact5: The flour is not stored in the pantry.
